questions.question: Which dark tourism site in Ukraine, known for a catastrophic nuclear event in 1986, draws visitors despite its exclusion zone?
questions.context: The disaster at this power plant is considered the worst nuclear accident in history. It has since become a symbol of the dangers of nuclear power and the site's effects remain a subject of study.

questions.question: What modern architectural marvel in the United Arab Emirates stands as the world's tallest building since its completion in 2010?
questions.context: Rising to a height of 828 meters, this skyscraper attracts millions of tourists annually and features a record numbers of stories and the highest outdoor observation deck in the world.

questions.question: What UNESCO World Heritage Site, located in Peru, was an important city from the Incan Empire era and rediscovered in 1911?
questions.context: Often referred to as the 'Lost City of the Incas', this site offers profound insights into Incan life and architecture and has become one of the most iconic archaeological sites in the world.

questions.question: Which historical battle site in Belgium marks the location of the 1815 defeat of Napoleon Bonaparte, effectively ending his rule?
questions.context: This battle was a decisive engagement in the Napoleonic Wars and the site now hosts numerous monuments and museums commemorating this epic historical event.

questions.question: Identify the famous museum in France renowned for housing the Mona Lisa and other masterpieces, making it the world's most visited museum as of 2023.
questions.context: Originally a royal palace, this museum covers more than 72,000 square meters and contains thousands of works spanning from prehistory to the 21st century.
